questions.question_text: Joe, a user, recently installed a new mouse for his laptop. Joe no longer uses a mouse pad because his office desk has a glass top. Joe notices that when he is at the office, the cursor moves on the screen when he does not move the mouse; however, it works fine when he is traveling. Which of the following is MOST likely cause?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
i belive d is right, it reflects the mouse sensor and it can go crazy

Selected Answer: C
What does it being reflective have anything to do with the mouse movie? The answer has to be C.

comments.content: That doesn't make sense. The mouse only doesn't work at his office with the glass countertop. If it was faulty it just wouldn't work in general any where Joe goes. Answer is D

discussion.content: I would have picked QOS if it was a bandwidth issue and an option lol. However, yes Tsholanang is correct resource pooling is how cloud computing gets you resources and how the tech would divide them up.
How does resource pooling help in this case? could someone please explain?

comments.content: It's a Virtual machine (cloud) and resource pooling in cloud is where you get all your resources

questions.question_text: A few users have been noticing ongoing degradation of performance in a VDI environment. A technician checks the environment and discovers the shared VM is experiencing maximum CPU utilization. Which of the following will the technician MOST likely configure to resolve the issue?

discussion.content: This is B! What does wireless have to do with anything?!

Selected Answer: B
It's B. Here doesn't talk about wireless problem. Instead, IP and name resolution, yes.

questions.question_text: A user is unable to access network resources on a laptop. A technician examines the device and attempts to reproduce the issue. The technician cannot connect to resources by name or IP. Which of the following should the technician check FIRST?

A sales executive's personal laptop occasionally freezes while checking email.
Which of the following should a technician do FIRST?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A technician should first gather information about the issue by requesting details from the sales executive about the problem. This information can include when the laptop freezes, what application was being used, and any error messages that were displayed. The technician can then use this information to make informed decisions about next steps, such as running hardware diagnostics, checking network connectivity, or considering the corporate policy.
for me , I'll go with B, since it's a personal laptop , so the technician need to refer to the company policy before any further action.

Selected Answer: C
you should at first get informations to find out, what the reason may be

Selected Answer: C
I will go for C, you should always collect enough information before establishing the theory of the probable cause
im not sure BUT id rather D

questions.question_text:
A high-end workstation is operating as expected, but two of the four SATA drives are displaying solid fault lights.
Which of the following is the MOST likely reason for this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The system is still operating. RAID 10 can survive the loss of one drive from each mirrored pair. Cache does not have anything to do with redundancy, so B is the correct answer.
The system is still operating. As zach said, it can survive the loss of one drive from each mirrored pair. Cache does not have anything to do with redundancy, so B is the correct answer, IMHO.

comments.content: no, a standard four-disk RAID 10 setup can only withstand one drive failure in each mirrored pair of disk drives. The answer is correct.

choices.C: An M.2 boot device is being used.
choices.D: The RAID controller cache is turned on.
choices.B: The RAID level of the disk array is 10.
